Name: Additional information collected and reported about foster care youth.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to additional information collected and reported about foster care youth

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Children and Youth
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
This Introduction was Approved by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders

Attachments.Name: Int. No. 1245-A - Fiscal Impact Statement - City Council
Int. No. 1245-A - Fiscal Impact Statement - OMB

Summary: This bill would amend the report on foster youth required by Local Law 145 of 2016 to require the data to be disaggregated by age. This bill would also require information to be collected on the council district of each supportive housing building to which foster youth are placed in.

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}

\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. The opening paragraph of subdivision b and paragraph 3 of subdivision b of section 21-902.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 145 for the year 2016, are amended to read as follows:\par
\cf1 b. Annual reports regarding youth and foster care. Beginning no later than [February 28, 2015] \ul April 30, 2026\ulnone  for the calendar year [2014] \ul 2025\ulnone  and [every year] \ul annually\ulnone  thereafter, ACS shall furnish to the speaker of the council [,] \ul and\ulnone  the public advocate, and post on [ACS] \ul ACS's\ulnone  website\ul ,\ulnone  a report regarding youth in foster care. Such report shall include the following information\ul ,\ulnone  disaggregated where available and indicated with an explanation where not available\ul ,\ulnone  by \ul age range,\ulnone  gender, race\ul ,\ulnone  and ethnicity:\cf0\par
\cf1 3. Youth who left foster care who were discharged to APPLA. The following information regarding youth who aged out of foster care[,] shall be included in the annual report:\par
i. number and percentage of youth who were on trial discharge status;\par
ii. number and percentage of youth who received housing assistance, broken down by the type of assistance as follows:\par
(a) NYCHA public housing;\par
(b) section 8 voucher;\par
(c) supportive housing\ul , disaggregated by council district\ulnone ;\par
(d) adult residential care;\par
(e) ACS housing subsidy;\par
(f) any other type of housing assistance, whether private, federal, state\ul ,\ulnone  or city-subsidized or operated, including information specifying the specific subsidies or resources utilized; provided, however, that the information required by this subparagraph shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
iii. number and percentage of young people who left foster care to alternative safe and stable housing, including\ul ,\ulnone  but not limited to\ul ,\ulnone  an apartment or other place of residence shared with friends or family members, or remained in the home of their foster families; provided, however, that this information shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
iv. number and percentage of youth who completed high school, disaggregated by the type of diploma or credential certification received;\par
v. number and percentage of youth who passed the TASC high school equivalency test;\par
vi. number and percentage of youth who obtained an education and training voucher;\par
vii. number and percentage of youth who are enrolled in college;\par
viii. number and percentage of youth who were enrolled in a vocational/trade program at the time of discharge;\par
ix. number and percentage of youth who obtained a college diploma, disaggregated by the type of diploma received; provided, however, that this information shall be included in such report only upon required New York state approval of the necessary changes to the discharge checklist, beginning with the report for the second calendar year following such approval;\par
x. number and percentage of youth who have a verifiable source of income;\par
xi. number and percentage of youth who obtained SIJS;\par
xii. number and percentage of youth who obtained lawful permanent resident status;\par
xiii. number and percentage of young people who were parents at the time of their discharge from foster care;\par
xiv. number and percentage of youth who had a permanent connection to a caring adult at the time of their discharge from foster care; \ul and\par
\ulnone xv. number and percentage of youth who were discharged as absent without leave at the time of their discharge from foster care.\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\cf0\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\ul  \ulnone\fs18\par
CY\par
